page.title: 03Farm Improvements:NEIL
page.content: Over the past years the government gave money to farmers as{improvement grants.Co.Fermanagh is a{less favoured {area}because the land is rougher than other parts of N.Ireland.The farmers employ{drainage contractors}to make drains which are dug out by large diggers.Then the drains are piped and filled with stones and bulldozed.To {reseed}the farmer ploughs the land with a tractor and plough.Next the field is disked with a disk.The disk is made up of small steel wheels which cuts up the scores.Once it is disked we gather the stones into a trailer. The field is then levelled with a land leveller which pulls the heights into the hollows.Then the grasseed is sown and it is harrowed into the ground and rolled with a heavy roller.Wire is put round the field to keep the sheep and cows in the field.
